Article.Abstract: Mycobacterium tuberculosis antigens that are recognized by human CD8+ T cells are potentially important vaccine target molecules. We used a motif-based strategy to screen selected proteins of M. tuberculosis for peptides predicted to bind to human leukocyte antigen (HLA)-A*0201. We identified two 10 amino acid peptides that elicited cytolytic T lymphocyte activity and interferon-gamma production by CD8+ T cells from HLA-A*0201+ healthy tuberculin reactors. These peptides were derived from the 38-kDa antigen and the 28-kDa hemolysin, the latter being a novel target for CD8+ T cells. We speculate that hemolysins may alter the phagosomal membrane surrounding intracellular M. tuberculosis, allowing themselves and other antigens to gain access to the major histocompatibility complex class I processing pathway.
Article.ArticleTitle: Human CD8+ T cells recognize epitopes of the 28-kDa hemolysin and the 38-kDa antigen of Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Article.Affiliations: Center for Pulmonary and Infectious Disease Control, University of Texas Health Center, 11937 U.S. Hwy. 271, Tyler, TX 75708-3154, USA. amir.shams@uthct.edu
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Antigens, Bacterial;Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;HLA-A Antigens;HLA-A*02:01 antigen;HLA-A2 Antigen;Hemolysin Proteins;Peptide Fragments;Mycobacterium tuberculosis antigens
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Adult; Antigens, Bacterial(immunology; metabolism); CD8-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology); Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay; Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte(immunology); HLA-A Antigens(metabolism); HLA-A2 Antigen; Hemolysin Proteins(immunology); Humans; Molecular Weight; Mycobacterium tuberculosis(immunology); Peptide Fragments(metabolism); T-Lymphocytes, Cytotoxic(immunology)

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were taken from healthy adult tuberculin reactors who had received no more that 4 weeks of isoniazid at the time of their enrollment. It was not specified how the donors were initially exposed to Tuberculosis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL activity was considered to be positive if net-specific lysis was greater than or equal to 10%.

Results were expressed as relative mean fluorescence intensity (MFI), calculated as the MFI of peptide-treated cells/MFI of cells treated with the HBc 18-27 peptide, which is known to bind HLA-A*0201.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were taken from healthy adult tuberculin reactors who had received no more that 4 weeks of isoniazid at the time of their enrollment. It was not specified how the donors were initially exposed to Tuberculosis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL activity was considered to be positive if net-specific lysis was greater than or equal to 10%.

Results were expressed as relative mean fluorescence intensity (MFI), calculated as the MFI of peptide-treated cells/MFI of cells treated with the HBc 18-27 peptide, which is known to bind HLA-A*0201.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were taken from healthy adult tuberculin reactors who had received no more that 4 weeks of isoniazid at the time of their enrollment. It was not specified how the donors were initially exposed to Tuberculosis. Short-term T cell lines were generated by stimulating PBMC from two donors with peptide and autologous, irradiated PBMC weekly for five to eight cycles.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: In an extension of this assay, in order to mimic the presence of CD4+ T cell help, CD8+ T cells were stimulated with CD40 ligand trimer, IL-2, and the peptide for 72 hours. The number of IFN-γ-producing cells was four-to fivefold higher than levels produced in the absence of peptide.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were taken from healthy adult tuberculin reactors who had received no more that 4 weeks of isoniazid at the time of their enrollment. It was not specified how the donors were initially exposed to Tuberculosis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL activity was considered to be positive if net-specific lysis was greater than or equal to 10%. The CTL activity of CD8+-depleted PBMC was measured in a similar experiment and it was shown that net-specific lysis was reduced by 65-100%. A similar response was also found using short-term T cell lines generated by stimulating PBMC from two donors weekly for five to eight cycles.

Results were expressed as relative mean fluorescence intensity (MFI), calculated as the MFI of peptide-treated cells/MFI of cells treated with the HBc 18-27 peptide, which is known to bind HLA-A*0201.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were taken from healthy adult tuberculin reactors who had received no more that 4 weeks of isoniazid at the time of their enrollment. It was not specified how the donors were initially exposed to Tuberculosis. Short-term T cell lines were generated by stimulating PBMC from two donors with peptide and autologous, irradiated PBMC weekly for five to eight cycles.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: In an extension of this assay, in order to mimic the presence of CD4+ T cell help, CD8+ T cells were stimulated with CD40 ligand trimer, IL-2, and the peptide for 72 hours. The number of IFN-γ-producing cells was four-to fivefold higher than the levels produced in the absence of peptide.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were taken from healthy adult tuberculin reactors who had received no more that 4 weeks of isoniazid at the time of their enrollment. It was not specified how the donors were initially exposed to Tuberculosis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL activity was considered to be positive if net-specific lysis was greater than or equal to 10%. The CTL activity of CD8+-depleted PBMC was measured in a similar experiment, and it was shown that net-specific lysis was reduced by 65-100%. CD8+ -enriched T cells showed modestly higher cytolytic activity. A similar response was also seen using short-term T cell lines generated by stimulating PBMC from two donors weekly for five to eight cycles.

Results were expressed as relative mean fluorescence intensity (MFI), calculated as the MFI of peptide-treated cells/MFI of cells treated with the HBc 18-27 peptide, which is known to bind HLA-A*0201.
